timeline.message: Redesigned and refactored parts of Base64Util, Base64UtilTest and Base64UrlTest to get rid of the PowerMock dependency in the project.

timeline.bodyText: This is for testing purposes only right? If not should this be atomic, or locked when modified, as this isn't completely thread-safe right now.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: It is only for testing purposes. I probably should add a clarifying comment though.
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: Would it be better to move the interface and class below to their own files?
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: Leaving them in this file is fine, I just didn't have a complete understanding of this when I wrote the comment.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Is this planned to be used in the public API? If so, instead of maintaining context in this static helper class should a new overload to each API be added which accepts this interface? That way this class remains thread safe and stateless as expected with a static helper class.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
This is not planned to be a part of the public API. The reason I wrote this interface was so we wouldn't have to mock the static methods in Android's Base64 class. This is due to a couple of reasons:

Unfortunately, we cannot use Java's version of this class since it only works with a higher Android version than our supported minimum.
We cannot access the Android framework's classes in unit tests, which are only accessible when running on the actual operating system on an emulator or physical device. Unit tests run on the local JVM.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: Is a wrapper being set as Base64 isn't consistent between Android versions or between devices?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: The reason to set this here is that we cannot call Android framework's classes like Base64 from unit tests and we cannot use Java's Base64 class because that's only available at a later Android version. To get around this and not use something like PowerMock to mock static methods like Base64.encode(), I created the Base64Wrapper interface. Normally it will always be set to Base64Android and for unit tests it will be set to Base64Stub.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: Any reason that assertEquals can't be used here? It would allow for the suppression to be removed.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: There is no reason not to use assertEquals. I must have missed it. Thanks for pointing it out!
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Does Base64Url's equals overload compare against the String representation? If so could this be assertNull(base64Url.toString())?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: You are right, we don't use the String representation of Base64Url for comparisons so this can be made to use assertNull.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Here we can just use assertNotEquals.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: I think some tests should be added that use non-null, right now this will get good code coverage but is missing real world scenarios.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Based on the test names, it actually seems I was planning to write the non-null tests but somehow got busy with something else and missed them.
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: I will correct and add tests that check for the positive scenarios when we have a non-null source and non-empty string.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Unless we have overridden the hash code method I wouldn't eagerly test this as it is dependent on the underlying JVM and has the potential for collisions.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: We did override it in our DateTimeRfc1123 class, however, it just uses the hashCode method in OffsetDateTime. I think I will remove this test for the time being.
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: Actually, after digging around on the internet, I think I will take the approach showed here.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Same comment as the other hashCode test.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: See comment above for the same question.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: How strong is the guarantee that the backing Map for ExandableStringEnum will return a collection where the elements are ordered by how they are added?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: There is no guarantee since this is not a LinkedHashSet, so I think the best course of action would be to cast the Collection returned by values() to a HashSet and see if the values we are looking for are contained there.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Added unit tests for the Base64Url and Base64Util classes.
Added unit tests for the CoreUtils, DateTimeRfc1123 and ExpandableStringEnum classes. Included the ThreetenBP package for our tests so timezone data is available.
Added license statement to test classes.
Added tests for toString() and hashCode() in Base64Url.
Modified CoreUtilTest and DateTimeRfc1123Test to conform to the latest changes in the dev branch made to their respective classes.
Redesigned and refactored parts of Base64Util, Base64UtilTest and Base64UrlTest to get rid of the PowerMock dependency in the project.

Addressed comments made by @alzimmermsft: refactored some assertions to remove the use of certain annotations to suppress warnings and changed hashCode() tests to ensure consistency no matter where they run.

Refactored the names of some tests in Base64UtilTest, also made sure to include testing for positive paths for decodeUrl() and encodeUrlWithoutPadding(). Removed import statements for static methods CoreUtils and used inline calls. Added copyright header to Base64Stub.

Refactored the names of some tests in Base64UtilTest, also made sure to include testing for positive paths for decodeUrl() and encodeUrlWithoutPadding(). Removed import statements for static methods CoreUtils and used inline calls. Added copyright header to Base64Stub.
